title: NASA's Mars Sample Return Mission Detects Organic Molecules
introText: NASA's Mars Sample Return mission has detected complex organic molecules in cached Martian samples. While not proof of life, the discovery suggests Mars once had conditions suitable for biology and strengthens the case for returning samples to Earth.

content.content: Perseverance rover detected complex organic molecules in rock samples from an ancient river delta. The molecules are consistent with either ancient biology or geological processes.
Organic molecules are essential building blocks of life. Their presence in samples from a location that once held water suggests Mars may have been habitable billions of years ago.
The discovery strengthens the urgency of returning samples to Earth, where sophisticated labs can determine if the organics are biological or geological in origin.
